text: East-West Dedicated Freight Corridor or East-West DFC is a freight specific railway under proposed in eastern to Western India by Indian Railways. The railway will run between Kolkata in West Bengal and Mumbai in Maharashtra. It was announced by Mr. Suresh Prabhu, Indian Railway Minister while presenting the Railway Budget of India 2016-17. The government has indicated that they are likely to use a foreign direct investment for funding the project. The project would be undertaken through PPP (Public Private Partnerships) model. Notably, freight train with speed of maximum 100 km per hour will pass through Chhattisgarh in the East-West Corridor (Kolkata-Mumbai). ==References== Category:Transport in Kolkata Category:Transport in Mumbai Category:Dedicated freight corridors of India Category:Rail transport in West Bengal Category:Rail transport in Odisha Category:Rail transport in Maharashtra Category:5 ft 6 in gauge railways in India
title: East-West Dedicated Freight Corridor
